description.plain:
Selena Gomez is an American singer and actress. Born in Grand Prairie, Texas, she appeared in Barney & Friends as a child. In 2007, Gomez came to prominence as a starring cast member of the Emmy Award-winning television series Wizards of Waverly Place, in which she portrayed the protagonist Alex Russo.

In 2008, Gomez signed to Hollywood Records and became the founder and lead singer of the pop band Selena Gomez & The Scene. Their studio albums Kiss & Tell, A Year Without Rain, and When the Sun Goes Down were all certified Gold by the Recording Industry Association of America (RIAA) and have spawned the platinum-certified singles “Naturally”, “Who Says”, and “Love You Like a Love Song”. Gomez’s debut solo album Stars Dance was released in summer 2013, and was preceded by its lead single “Come & Get It”.

In November 2014, Gomez made a greatest hits compilation called For You, which included the (at the time new) hit single “The Heart Wants What It Wants.” Gomez’s contract with Hollywood Records expired, and she signed a contract with Interscope for her second solo album Revival, which was released in October 2015.

She has since released various singles including “Back To You”, a single from the TV series Thirteen Reasons Why and “Taki Taki” with DJ Snake, Cardi B and Ozuna. Her third solo album, Rare was released in January 2020.

In 2017, Selena was awarded the Billboard Woman of the Year Award.

description.plain:
After four years of releasing droplet singles, Selena Gomez released “Lose You To Love Me,” a self-love anthem featuring melancholic lyrics about discovering her true self through the difficult process of losing a lover.

The song is the lead single from her highly anticipated third studio album, Rare, and has been seemingly confirmed to be about her rocky relationship with ex-boyfriend Justin Bieber.

A music video was released alongside the song. The music video was shot completely on an iPhone for Apple’s “Shot on iPhone” campaign; these words and the Apple logo can be seen in a promotional video posted by Apple.

The cover art for the track and release date were shared by Selena on Twitter on October 18, 2019. More hype for the release of the song began to build when a credible insider on the music forum ATRL made a cryptic comment “2.2.22.23” on a popular discussion forum about Selena’s music. Many fans immediately pieced together the information and theorized that on either the 22nd or 23rd of October, “Lose You to Love Me” would be released with a music video and another single. As it turned out, Selena released her second single, “Look At Her Now,” the following day.

description.plain:
“Back to You” is an upbeat love ballad that sees Selena sing her heart out and express her love for her significant other, even though that person may be able to hurt her again.

The song was first teased through a leaked Spotify advertisement. Lyrics for the song were previewed on Selena Gomez’s Instagram leading up to its premiere on Zane Lowe’s World Record feature on Apple Music’s Beats 1 radio station.

The promotion for the song prominently featured polaroid photographs. This was likely directly influenced by 13 Reasons Why—photographs play a large role in the trailer for season two.

description.plain:
On “Fetish,” Selena acts as the object of affection of an obsessive sexual partner. She first teased the single at the end of the music video for her previous single “Bad Liar,” with about 17 seconds of the “Fetish” video.

Although she was in a relationship with The Weeknd during recording of this track, it is not built around their relationship. Selena commented on this topic during a June 9, 2017 interview on The Zach Sang Show:

I think for me, I like to keep that really separate. … So as much as that has been inspiring … the moment I start doing something because I’m influenced by someone else, it just doesn’t work out.

Selena revealed the official date release and the artwork for the track on Twitter and Instagram.

description.plain:
According to co-writer Justin Tranter, “Bad Liar” is about “trying to hide magical feelings for someone new, but not being able to.”

The track is the latest single from Selena Gomez released on May 18, 2017. Although it is not yet linked to any project, it could be a first single for one.

The track interpolates the bassline of Talking Heads‘ 1977 classic “Psycho Killer."

For more on the lyrics, check the official premiere article here: https://genius.com/a/selena-gomez-premieres-the-lyrics-to-her-new-single-bad-liar

description.plain:
“Look At Her Now” is an upbeat song about becoming a stronger person after a turbulent relationship. It is a track from Selena’s upcoming album, preceded by its vulnerable and emotional lead single, “Lose You To Love Me,” which was released only a day before. It is also worth noting that the music videos for both songs were collaborations with Apple, and both videos were “Shot on iPhone” for the campaign of the same name.

Rumors about the song started swirling on October 16th, 2019, when a credible ‘insider’ from the music forum ATRL commented “2.2.22.23” on a thread discussing Selena’s music. Fans then pieced together the information and theorized that Selena would release new music on the 22nd and 23rd of October, alongside a music video for each song. Later, he then proceeded to reveal the title of the 2 songs: “Lose You to Love Me” and “Look At Her Now.”

Fans also speculated that the childhood photos Selena had posted were an easter egg for “Look At Her Now”.

description.plain:
“Good For You” is a song about feeling good about yourself, and looking good for your lover.

The lead single from Selena Gomez’s second album as a solo artist, Revival, it was a massive international hit, charting in 24 different countries, reaching #1 in Greece and #5 on the Billboard Hot 100.



According to Songfacts, speaking during an On Air with Ryan Seacrest interview, Gomez claimed the song’s lyrical content was deeper than merely being about a woman wanting to look good for her lover:

There’s nothing wrong with a woman being comfortable, confident, [or] whatever it is that you feel. I love that, I love feeling like I’m in love and want to look good for someone. At the same time, there’s no guy in the [music] video, I’m saying I am a diamond, and I like the way that women feel when they’re in that state.

When the first official music video released in June of 2015, many were surprised that it did not contain A$AP Rocky’s feature verse. A second video was released later with ASAP’s vocals included.

description.plain:
With her Greatest Hits album For You, Selena Gomez released this as the lead single for the project.

This song sees an emotional Selena explaining her account of her relationship with Justin Bieber (although she doesn’t actually name him), and seemingly justifying why she remained with him for so long.

The title phrase was made famous in an Emily Dickinson poem:

The heart wants what it wants—or else it does not care

description.plain:
Track three of Revival, “Hands to Myself,” is a celebration of love overcoming inhibition. As is consistent throughout the album, “Hands to Myself” introduces a newfound sultry side of Selena, perpetuating the idea that 2015 was the year teen pop grew up.



“Hands To Myself” is my favorite. It’s actually one of the last songs I recorded for the album. It’s the second to last song I recorded, and we wrote it in a day, and it was incredible because I had this sass. I finished everything. I thought the album was done, and then I kind of went in, and I felt like I was ready for the next chapter, whatever it is, and I just knew that it had this sass to it. It’s really different, and it’s fresh, and it’s kind of got this Prince-y vibe to it. I really appreciate that it’s kind of different from everything else.
—Selena Gomez via iHeartRadio

Many critics noted that the song’s guitar riff is reminiscent of the Pixies’ 1988 track “Where is My Mind?”

Click here to read Selena’s verified annotation about the production and songwriting.

https://twitter.com/selenagomez/status/652516895837528064

description.plain:
During the iHeartMedia Summit, Interscope Records announced that Selena’s next official single of her second solo album Revival is called “Same Old Love.” It was released on September 9 alongside the preorder.

To snaps, piano, and a reggae guitar, Selena Gomez breaks it off with a wearying lover. Charli XCX provides chorus vocals.



Teaser #1 and Teaser #2 were released in anticipation of the song’s release.

The music video premiered on Apple Music on the 23rd September 2015 and was later released on YouTube on October 7.

Selena posted a “show and tell” version to her official Youtube account on the 9th November 2015 where she talks us through the music video.

description.plain:
“Feel Me” was originally an unreleased song by Selena Gomez, which first appeared online in 2016. A year prior, Gomez had performed the song for the first time on her 2016 Revival Tour. The final version of the song appears on the vinyl edition of Gomez' 2020 studio album Rare and has been released as a digital download on iTunes.

Lyrically, the song is about an ex who won’t forget about their significant other anytime soon. She hopes her presence and memory sticks with them, even when they are no longer together.

description.plain:
The existence of Gomez’s title track, “Rare,” was first confirmed on August 16, 2018, when she went on an Instagram live to share that her “favorite song [off her new album is the title track].”

The song is a self-empowerment anthem about independence and self-love.

A demo now speculated to be sung by co-writer Madison Love (singer-songwriter Emily Warren was intially credited) leaked in full back in late 2018, causing a frenzy on Twitter.

The song’s lyrics were then later teased in an interview with ELLE on September 4, 2018.

description.plain:
“Kill Em With Kindness” is the second track and fourth and last single on Selena Gomez second solo album Revival, released on October 9th, 2015.

The song is about using peaceful actions to overcome our everyday obstacles and limitations.

Selena told iHeartRadio about the song:

Everybody needs to hear it. It’s kind of my motto for life. It’s so much easier to be mean. It’s so easy to just kind of give yourself that, but it’s so hard to walk away from a situation, turn your cheek the other way, and be the bigger person. So, that’s what ‘Kill Em With Kindness’ represents. I think people need to hear that more often.

“A Sweeter Place” is a Contemporary R&B collaboration with American rapper Kid Cudi. Both artists sing about wanting to find “a sweeter place” to keep their worries “all away.”

Although it is unclear when the pair first met and decided to collaborate, they took a photo together back in November 3, 2019, at ComplexCon.

Prior to the song’s official release, a snippet of it was heard in the album trailer for her third studio album, Rare, posted to her social media platforms on December 12, 2019.

description.plain:
“Cut You Off” is a midtempo track from Selena Gomez’s third studio album, Rare. The song is about someone moving on from a past relationship and feeling better about themselves.

It was revealed by the co-writer Liza Owen via Instagram that the song was written about an “asshole boy who shall not be named.” This led to many speculating it was about her ex-boyfriend, Justin Bieber. Interestingly, “Cut You Off” is the only explicit track released on Rare.

The song was first teased back in an interview with ELLE on September 4, 2018, where she “[hit] ‘play’ on [the track].” The interviewer, Mickey Rapkin, even described the song:

[It’s] about cutting a man out of her life after “1,460 days” and [cleaning her slate].

A snippet of the song was first teased on December 12, 2019, when Selena uploaded an album trailer for Rare on her social media platforms.

description.plain:
“Perfect” is a bonus track from the deluxe edition of Selena Gomez' second solo album Revival, which was released on 9 October 2015.

Quite a few fans think the ‘'you’‘ Selena sings about in this song refers to her ex-boyfriend Justin Bieber. She has not confirmed this, but many songs on Revival are about love and heartbreak and both Bieber and Gomez have opened up about the difficulties of their relationship in relatively recent interviews.

Selena spoke about “Perfect” with iHeartRadio HQ:

That was a very, very personal song, and it was extremely accurate. I remember feeling all of those emotions, and thinking to myself, ‘I don’t know if I could put this on the record.’ In a way, it’s a little sad. It’s beautiful too. I really enjoy being able to go in that R&B and just flow in that world, and the track is unbelievable, but I was nervous to put it on the record for that reason. I felt like if I was already giving my all, I might as well acknowledge that part.

description.plain:
“Revival” is the title track from Selena Gomez' second solo album, which was released on 9 October 2015.

A snippet of the song was played during a special fan event in Los Angeles on 16 September 2015.

During a track-by-track interview on Twitter, she said that it’s one of the most important tracks on the album, because it’s an introduction to “what I’ve been spending the past two years experiencing, feeling and going through”.

description.plain:
“Come & Get It” is a song recorded by American singer Selena Gomez for her debut solo album Stars Dance.

The song was written by Ester Dean, M.S. Eriksen, and T.E. Hermansen and was produced by Stargate. Meanwhile, the vocals were produced by Dreamlab. The song features elements of electropop and even Indian music.

Gomez stated:

I just remember recording it and being in the studio and just thinking of how the place I was in and what I was going through and I was just so excited about it and I wanted it to be the first single.

In this uptempo song, Selena sings about feeling a sense of freedom from the thoughts in her head, and she doesn’t want the joy she feels to be shot down.
This song definitely has some characteristics of “Dance Again”, the second track of Rare.

description.plain:
“She” is basically a conversation Selena goes through with herself and how she’s telling a story of her own life while looking at what happened from a distance. This might be because of the fact that we can notice much more and be more objective in a situation if we look at it from distance, as if we were the third person. A lot of people say that, especially when it comes to relationships. We don’t notice things other people do, we don’t see what isn’t working out, we believe that our relationship is in a good place while other people who aren’t in love with that person can see the real truth. We might even get mad at someone for pointing truth while we’re blind but after things are done, we realize that a lot of that was actually the truth. That’s when we kind of think “wish I could’ve seen that before, wish I could’ve believed others” or even I wish I could tell myself before that this is happening.
This song is similar to “Look At Her Now” where Selena talks about  her experiences as a third person.

description.plain:
“Slow Down” is a song by American recording artist Selena Gomez, taken from her debut solo studio album, Stars Dance (2013).

It was released on June 3, 2013, when it was made available for instant digital download along with the pre-order of the album.

Hollywood Records later sent the song to mainstream radio as the second and final single from the album on August 13.

The dance-pop song was produced by The Cataracs and David Kuncio, and infuses EDM elements in its instrumentation.

Lyrically, the song speaks of slowing down time and living in one magical moment on the dance floor.

On the Billboard Hot 100 in the United States, “Slow Down” peaked at number 27, and has been certified Gold by the Recording Industry Association of America (RIAA), for selling over 500,000 units of the single in the country

description.plain:
“Me & My Girls” is a bonus track from the deluxe edition of Selena Gomez' second solo album Revival, which was released on 9 October 2015.
The song has Spanish influences.

Selena invited her best friends into the studio to make the shouting and laughing sounds you hear in the background on the track.

Gomez performed this song at the Victoria’s Secret Fashion Show in 2015.

description.plain:
“Nobody” is a bonus track from the deluxe edition of Selena Gomez' second solo album Revival, which was released on 9 October 2015.

Selena says that the song is about God.

https://twitter.com/selenagomez/status/652521471017771008

Selena told iHeartRadio:

‘Nobody’ is written about my faith, my connection with God. Anyone can interpret that however they want. It’s a beautiful record, but that was my intention when I wrote the song. No human being can love you the way that your higher power can, and I think it’s beautiful. You have to love yourself. You have to find that within your heart and that’s when I was able to discover myself.

description.plain:
On the playful and catchy “Fun,” Selena describes falling into a relationship with someone she knows is bad for her.

Upon the release of the track, many have pointed out that the song has similar characteristics to co-writer Julia Michaels' solo music while others like NME have praised it as “a brighter take on her [May 2017 single “Bad Liar”].”

description.plain:
“Stained” is an unreleased song by Selena Gomez that leaked online on July 13th, 2017, the release day of her second single “Fetish” featuring hip-hop recording artist Gucci Mane. The song was recorded in 2016 for Selena’s third studio album.

With background vocals similar to those from “Wolves” by Kanye West, this song has been speculated to be produced by Cashmere Cat as Selena has also worked with him on his track, “Trust Nobody”.

Selena first previewed the song on Snapchat in 2016. She wrote, “Getting Impatient – Want to share more.”

There is no word yet about what Selena and her team will decide to do with the song since it leaked before being released officially.

description.plain:
Selena Gomez gets remorseful over her break up with Justin Bieber, don’t worry he does that too here. Their love was so strong that even though it’s gone, love will remember.

The early versions of the song featured a saved voicemail from Justin himself, but the final album version cut this out because Sel’s bff Taylor Swift told her it might not be the best idea.

description.plain:
“Body Heat” is a song from Selena Gomez' second solo album Revival, which was released on 9 October 2015.

During an track-by-track interview on Twitter, she told that the song was recorded in Mexico with Hit-Boy. “It was full on inspired by the culture. I thought it was important for me to have a song on the album that represented that side of me.” As her father is of Mexican descent.

description.plain:
“Birthday” is the first track on Stars Dance. True to its form, the record was released around Selena’s real birthday.

This track was written and produced by Mike Del Rio with additional writing from Crista Russo and Jacob Kasher Hindlin.

Musically, “Birthday” combines deep electronic dance beats and police sirens with elements of trap music. The songs instrumentation is created by blending purring, synthesized bass, snappy beats, handclaps, “oxygen-sucking” sub-bass, and trap snares with sexual moans and elements of hip hop music

This song influences girl power with risqué lyrics, Happy Birthday Sel!

description.plain:
“Same Old Love” got stuck at #6 on the Billboard Hot 100 (her third single to do so) but Selena chose the right guy drive it up. Today, the singer released an official remix of her single in collaboration with none other than Fetty Wap.

This is the second time that Selena invite a rapper to assist on a track from Revival. The first was with A$AP Rocky on “Good For You”.

description.plain:
“Higher Or Heaven” is a scrapped song from Selena Gomez’s so-called second studio album.

It was recorded in 2016 along with “Feel Me” & “Stained” and it’s also rumored that Halsey is featured on.

In the song, the 26-year-old singer describes, what it appears to be, a past relationship while also sharing concerns about her life, this is after being diagnosed with Lupus.

Fortunately for fans, a studio version of the track surfaced on the internet on February 24, 2018, although it is speculated that this leaked version is not the final one and instead just a simple demo.

description.plain:
“Save The Day” is the seventh track from Selena Gomez' debut solo album Stars Dance, and like many of it’s predesscors on the album (e.g. “Come & Get It”, “Birthday” “Slow Down” & “Like A Champion”), Save The Day has a heavy EDM, club-ready sound influence.

The song was written by Olivia Waithe (a.k.a Livvi Franc), Mitch Allan & Jason Evigan, a.ka. production and hitmaker duo “The Suspex”. With the production being handled by the latter two.

Lyrically the song finds Gomez in a club situation, hindered with serious sparks made with a guy. Having unexpected amounts of energy throughout the night, she doesn’t want the night to end because it will mean they have to depart.

Gomez performing “Save the Day” in Los Angeles, 2013.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hg6fW_fTZ3I

description.plain: “Sad Serenade” is a song by American pop singer Selena Gomez. The song had been speculated to appear on Gomez’s debut album, Stars Dance, but never was. Gomez first mentioned the song in a tweet on January 29, 2013. Hollywood Records sold the song, and the instrumental can be heard in the ‘Bruno Mars – Locked Out Of Heaven (Sultan & Ned Shepard Remix)’ on YouTube.

description.plain:
“Girl Crush”  is an unreleased song by singer/songwriter Selena Gomez featuring Iggy Azalea. It is an outtake from Gomez’s album ‘'Revival’‘.

The title of the song was first confirmed in 2015 by Azalea herself in a tweet back to a fan. There was a lot of hype about the song, but no other information was revealed until December 6th, 2017, when a snippet of the song landed on the net and the full song was auctioned on Music Mafia (A website which illegally sells unreleased songs) But the full version didn’t leak. The song was put back again on the auction in May 2018 and allegedly was sold on an auction for almost $2,000.

In 2018, in an episode of Watch What Happens Live with Andy Cohen, Iggy Azalea said “Yes, that is true,” “We did record a song called ‘Girl Crush,’ it was many years ago in 2015, so no, I think it’s safe to say it won’t be released, or it would have been already.”

The full song leaked on October 28th, 2019.

description.plain: “Beautifully Disturbed” was a song Gomez was working on for her 2009 album Kiss & Tell, when she was still performing with The Scene. As documented by a fan, Gomez spoke to TWIST about the song, saying the title came from a nickname someone gave her.
